sid.description: The SID of the Billing Period

account_sid.description: The SID of the Account the Super SIM belongs to

sim_sid.description: The SID of the Super SIM the Billing Period belongs to

start_time.description: The start time of the Billing Period

end_time.description: The end time of the Billing Period

period_type.description: The type of the Billing Period

smdp_plus_address.description: Address of the SM-DP+ server from which the Profile will be downloaded

error_code.description: Code indicating the failure if the download of the SIM Profile failed and the eSIM Profile is in `failed` state

error_message.description: Error message describing the failure if the download of the SIM Profile failed and the eSIM Profile is in `failed` state

date_updated.description: The ISO 8601 date and time in GMT when the resource was last updated

date_updated.description: The ISO 8601 date and time in GMT when the resource was last updated

url.description: The absolute URL of the Fleet resource

data_enabled.description: Defines whether SIMs in the Fleet are capable of using data connectivity

data_limit.description: The total data usage (download and upload combined) in Megabytes that each Super SIM assigned to the Fleet can consume

data_metering.description: The model by which a SIM is metered and billed

sms_commands_enabled.description: Defines whether SIMs in the Fleet are capable of sending and receiving machine-to-machine SMS via Commands

network_access_profile_sid.description: The SID of the Network Access Profile of the Fleet

ip_commands_url.description: The URL that will receive a webhook when a Super SIM in the Fleet is used to send an IP Command from your device

ip_commands_method.description: A string representing the HTTP method to use when making a request to `ip_commands_url`

sim_iccid.description: The ICCID of the Super SIM that this IP Command was sent to or from

direction.description: The direction of the IP Command

device_ip.description: The IP address of the device that the IP Command was sent to or received from

device_port.description: The port that the IP Command either originated from or was sent to

payload_type.description: The payload type of the IP Command

fleet_sid.description: SID of the Fleet resource on which the usage occurred.

period.description: The time period for which the usage is reported.

data_upload.description: Total data uploaded in bytes, aggregated by the query parameters.

data_download.description: Total data downloaded in bytes, aggregated by the query parameters.

data_total_billed.description: Total amount in the `billed_unit` that was charged for the data uploaded or downloaded.

billed_unit.description: The currency in which the billed amounts are measured, specified in the 3 letter ISO 4127 format (e.g. `USD`, `EUR`, `JPY`).

info.title: Twilio - Supersim
info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.

/v1/Sims/{SimSid}/BillingPeriods.description: Billing Period for an IoT Super SIM

get.description: Retrieve a list of Billing Periods for a Super SIM.

parameters.name: SimSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Super SIM to list Billing Periods for.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

/v1/ESimProfiles.description: eSIM Profiles that can be loaded onto consumer eUICC SIMs

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call using the `callback_method` when the status of the eSIM Profile changes. At this stage of the eSIM Profile pilot, the a request to the URL will only be called when the ESimProfile resource changes from `reserving` to `available`.

CallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and the default is POST.

Eid.description: Identifier of the eUICC that will claim the eSIM Profile.

get.description: Retrieve a list of eSIM Profiles.

parameters.name: Eid
parameters.description: List the eSIM Profiles that have been associated with an EId.

parameters.name: SimSid
parameters.description: Find the eSIM Profile resource related to a [Sim](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/sim-resource) resource by providing the SIM SID. Will always return an array with either 1 or 0 records.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: List the eSIM Profiles that are in a given status.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

/v1/ESimProfiles/{Sid}.description: eSIM Profiles that can be loaded onto consumer eUICC SIMs

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the eSIM Profile resource to fetch.

/v1/Fleets.description: Configure shared settings inherited by all Super SIMs assigned to the Fleet

NetworkAccessProfile.description: The SID or unique name of the Network Access Profile that will control which cellular networks the Fleet's SIMs can connect to.

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL to address the resource.

DataEnabled.description: Defines whether SIMs in the Fleet are capable of using 2G/3G/4G/LTE/CAT-M data connectivity. Defaults to `true`.

DataLimit.description: The total data usage (download and upload combined) in Megabytes that each Super SIM assigned to the Fleet can consume during a billing period (normally one month). Value must be between 1MB (1) and 2TB (2,000,000). Defaults to 1GB (1,000).

IpCommandsUrl.description: The URL that will receive a webhook when a Super SIM in the Fleet is used to send an IP Command from your device to a special IP address. Your server should respond with an HTTP status code in the 200 range; any response body will be ignored.

IpCommandsMethod.description: A string representing the HTTP method to use when making a request to `ip_commands_url`. Can be one of `POST` or `GET`. Defaults to `POST`.

SmsCommandsEnabled.description: Defines whether SIMs in the Fleet are capable of sending and receiving machine-to-machine SMS via Commands. Defaults to `true`.

SmsCommandsUrl.description: The URL that will receive a webhook when a Super SIM in the Fleet is used to send an SMS from your device to the SMS Commands number. Your server should respond with an HTTP status code in the 200 range; any response body will be ignored.

SmsCommandsMethod.description: A string representing the HTTP method to use when making a request to `sms_commands_url`. Can be one of `POST` or `GET`. Defaults to `POST`.

get.description: Retrieve a list of Fleets from your account.

parameters.name: NetworkAccessProfile
parameters.description: The SID or unique name of the Network Access Profile that controls which cellular networks the Fleet's SIMs can connect to.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

/v1/Fleets/{Sid}.description: Configure shared settings inherited by all Super SIMs assigned to the Fleet

get.description: Fetch a Fleet instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Fleet resource to fetch.

post.description: Updates the given properties of a Super SIM Fleet instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Fleet resource to update.

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL to address the resource.

NetworkAccessProfile.description: The SID or unique name of the Network Access Profile that will control which cellular networks the Fleet's SIMs can connect to.

IpCommandsUrl.description: The URL that will receive a webhook when a Super SIM in the Fleet is used to send an IP Command from your device to a special IP address. Your server should respond with an HTTP status code in the 200 range; any response body will be ignored.

IpCommandsMethod.description: A string representing the HTTP method to use when making a request to `ip_commands_url`. Can be one of `POST` or `GET`. Defaults to `POST`.

SmsCommandsUrl.description: The URL that will receive a webhook when a Super SIM in the Fleet is used to send an SMS from your device to the SMS Commands number. Your server should respond with an HTTP status code in the 200 range; any response body will be ignored.

SmsCommandsMethod.description: A string representing the HTTP method to use when making a request to `sms_commands_url`. Can be one of `POST` or `GET`. Defaults to `POST`.

DataLimit.description: The total data usage (download and upload combined) in Megabytes that each Super SIM assigned to the Fleet can consume during a billing period (normally one month). Value must be between 1MB (1) and 2TB (2,000,000). Defaults to 1GB (1,000).

/v1/IpCommands.description: Machine-to-machine IP Commands sent to/from Super SIMs

post.description: Send an IP Command to a Super SIM.

Sim.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the [Super SIM](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iot/supersim/api/sim-resource) to send the IP Command to.

Payload.description: The payload to be delivered to the device.

DevicePort.description: The device port to which the IP Command will be sent.

PayloadType.description: Indicates how the payload is encoded. Either `text` or `binary`. Defaults to `text`.

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call using the `callback_method` after we have sent the IP Command.

CallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `callback_url`. Can be `GET` or `POST`, and the default is `POST`.

get.description: Retrieve a list of IP Commands from your account.

parameters.name: Sim
parameters.description: The SID or unique name of the Sim resource that IP Command was sent to or from.

parameters.name: SimIccid
parameters.description: The ICCID of the Sim resource that IP Command was sent to or from.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the IP Command. Can be: `queued`, `sent`, `received` or `failed`. See the [IP Command Status Values](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/ipcommand-resource#status-values) for a description of each.

parameters.name: Direction
parameters.description: The direction of the IP Command. Can be `to_sim` or `from_sim`. The value of `to_sim` is synonymous with the term `mobile terminated`, and `from_sim` is synonymous with the term `mobile originated`.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

/v1/IpCommands/{Sid}.description: Machine-to-machine IP Commands sent to/from Super SIMs

get.description: Fetch IP Command instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the IP Command resource to fetch.

/v1/Networks/{Sid}.description: Mobile operator networks to which Super SIMs can connect

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Network resource to fetch.

/v1/Networks.description: Mobile operator networks to which Super SIMs can connect

get.description: Retrieve a list of Network resources.

parameters.name: IsoCountry
parameters.description: The [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) of the Network resources to read.

parameters.name: Mcc
parameters.description: The 'mobile country code' of a country. Network resources with this `mcc` in their `identifiers` will be read.

parameters.name: Mnc
parameters.description: The 'mobile network code' of a mobile operator network. Network resources with this `mnc` in their `identifiers` will be read.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

post.description: Create a new Network Access Profile

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL to address the resource.

Networks.description: List of Network SIDs that this Network Access Profile will allow connections to.

get.description: Retrieve a list of Network Access Profiles from your account.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

get.description: Fetch a Network Access Profile instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Network Access Profile resource to fetch.

post.description: Updates the given properties of a Network Access Profile in your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Network Access Profile to update.

UniqueName.description: The new unique name of the Network Access Profile.

/v1/NetworkAccessProfiles/{NetworkAccess.description: Mobile operator networks which Network Access Profiles allow access to

get.description: Retrieve a list of Network Access Profile resource's Network resource.

parameters.name: NetworkAccessProfileSid
parameters.description: The unique string that identifies the Network Access Profile resource.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

post.description: Add a Network resource to the Network Access Profile resource.

parameters.name: NetworkAccessProfileSid
parameters.description: The unique string that identifies the Network Access Profile resource.

Network.description: The SID of the Network resource to be added to the Network Access Profile resource.

/v1/NetworkAccessProfiles/{NetworkAccess.description: Mobile operator networks which Network Access Profiles allow access to

delete.description: Remove a Network resource from the Network Access Profile resource's.

parameters.name: NetworkAccessProfileSid
parameters.description: The unique string that identifies the Network Access Profile resource.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Network resource to be removed from the Network Access Profile resource.

get.description: Fetch a Network Access Profile resource's Network resource.

parameters.name: NetworkAccessProfileSid
parameters.description: The unique string that identifies the Network Access Profile resource.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Network resource to fetch.

post.description: Register a Super SIM to your Account

Iccid.description: The [ICCID](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscriber_identity_module#ICCID) of the Super SIM to be added to your Account.

RegistrationCode.description: The 10-digit code required to claim the Super SIM for your Account.

get.description: Retrieve a list of Super SIMs from your account.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the Sim resources to read. Can be `new`, `ready`, `active`, `inactive`, or `scheduled`.

parameters.name: Fleet
parameters.description: The SID or unique name of the Fleet to which a list of Sims are assigned.

parameters.name: Iccid
parameters.description: The [ICCID](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscriber_identity_module#ICCID) associated with a Super SIM to filter the list by. Passing this parameter will always return a list containing zero or one SIMs.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

get.description: Fetch a Super SIM instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Sim resource to fetch.

post.description: Updates the given properties of a Super SIM instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the Sim resource to update.

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL to address the resource.

Status.description: The new status of the resource. Can be: `ready`, `active`, or `inactive`. See the [Super SIM Status Values](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iot/supersim/api/sim-resource#status-values) for more info.

Fleet.description: The SID or unique name of the Fleet to which the SIM resource should be assigned.

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call using the `callback_method` after an asynchronous update has finished.

CallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and the default is POST.

AccountSid.description: The SID of the Account to which the Sim resource should belong. The Account SID can only be that of the requesting Account or that of a Subaccount of the requesting Account. Only valid when the Sim resource's status is new.

/v1/Sims/{SimSid}/IpAddresses.description: IP Addresses for a Super SIM configured to use a VPN connection

get.description: Retrieve a list of IP Addresses for the given Super SIM.

parameters.name: SimSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Super SIM to list IP Addresses for.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

/v1/SmsCommands.description: Machine-to-machine SMS Commands sent to/from SIMs

post.description: Send SMS Command to a Sim.

Sim.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the [SIM](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iot/supersim/api/sim-resource) to send the SMS Command to.

Payload.description: The message body of the SMS Command.

CallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and the default is POST.

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call using the `callback_method` after we have sent the command.

get.description: Retrieve a list of SMS Commands from your account.

parameters.name: Sim
parameters.description: The SID or unique name of the Sim resource that SMS Command was sent to or from.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the SMS Command. Can be: `queued`, `sent`, `delivered`, `received` or `failed`. See the [SMS Command Status Values](https://www.twilio.com/docs/wireless/api/smscommand-resource#status-values) for a description of each.

parameters.name: Direction
parameters.description: The direction of the SMS Command. Can be `to_sim` or `from_sim`. The value of `to_sim` is synonymous with the term `mobile terminated`, and `from_sim` is synonymous with the term `mobile originated`.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

/v1/SmsCommands/{Sid}.description: Machine-to-machine SMS Commands sent to/from SIMs

get.description: Fetch SMS Command instance from your account.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The SID of the SMS Command resource to fetch.

parameters.name: Sim
parameters.description: SID or unique name of a Sim resource. Only show UsageRecords representing usage incurred by this Super SIM.

parameters.name: Fleet
parameters.description: SID or unique name of a Fleet resource. Only show UsageRecords representing usage for Super SIMs belonging to this Fleet resource at the time the usage occurred.

parameters.name: Network
parameters.description: SID of a Network resource. Only show UsageRecords representing usage on this network.

parameters.name: IsoCountry
parameters.description: Alpha-2 ISO Country Code. Only show UsageRecords representing usage in this country.

parameters.name: Group
parameters.description: Dimension over which to aggregate usage records. Can be: `sim`, `fleet`, `network`, `isoCountry`. Default is to not aggregate across any of these dimensions, UsageRecords will be aggregated into the time buckets described by the `Granularity` parameter.

parameters.name: Granularity
parameters.description: Time-based grouping that UsageRecords should be aggregated by. Can be: `hour`, `day`, or `all`. Default is `all`. `all` returns one UsageRecord that describes the usage for the entire period.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: Only include usage that occurred at or after this time, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format. Default is one month before the `end_time`.

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: Only include usage that occurred before this time (exclusive), specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format. Default is the current time.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

x-maturity.name: Beta
x-maturity.description: PLEASE NOTE that this is a Beta product that is subject to change. Use it with caution.
